knowledgechecksdata.title: What area of focus from 2023 is expected to continue into 2024, per the Director of the Division of Corporate Finance?
knowledgechecksdata.question: What area of focus from 2023 is expected to continue into 2024, per the Director of the Division of Corporate Finance?
knowledgechecksdata.instruction: Select an answer and click Submit.

options.text: A. Disclosures resulting from recently adopted rules

individual.feedback: A is correct. Areas of focus from 2023 which are expected to continue in 2024 per the statement made by Erik Gerding, Director of the Division of Corporate Finance, include market disruptions in the banking industry and disclosures about interest rate and liquidity risk, impacts of inflation and related risks, disclosures by companies based in or with major operations in China, and disclosures resulting from recently adopted rules.

B is incorrect. While the SEC did issue comments related to debt and equity, they were not determined to be an area of focus for 2023 or 2024. The majority of comments related to debt and equity focused on classification and inadequate disclosure. The correct answer is A. Areas of focus from 2023 which are expected to continue in 2024 per the statement made by Erik Gerding, Director of the Division of Corporate Finance, include market disruptions in the banking industry and disclosures about interest rate and liquidity risk, impacts of inflation and related risks, disclosures by companies based in or with major operations in China, and disclosures resulting from recently adopted rules.

C is incorrect. While the SEC did issue comments related to inventory, they were not determined to be an area of focus for 2023 or 2024. The majority of comments related to inventory focused on disclosure of the basis of accounting for inventory and components of costs of sales. The correct answer is A. Areas of focus from 2023 which are expected to continue in 2024 per the statement made by Erik Gerding, Director of the Division of Corporate Finance, include market disruptions in the banking industry and disclosures about interest rate and liquidity risk, impacts of inflation and related risks, disclosures by companies based in or with major operations in China, and disclosures resulting from recently adopted rules.

D is incorrect. While the SEC did issue comments related to internal controls, they were not determined to be an area of focus for 2023 or 2024. The majority of comments related to internal controls focused on incomplete disclosures, inconsistency in assessments and errors. The correct answer is A. Areas of focus from 2023 which are expected to continue in 2024 per the statement made by Erik Gerding, Director of the Division of Corporate Finance, include market disruptions in the banking industry and disclosures about interest rate and liquidity risk, impacts of inflation and related risks, disclosures by companies based in or with major operations in China, and disclosures resulting from recently adopted rules.

knowledgechecksdata.title: Which of the following disclosure requirements did the SEC recently issue compliance and disclosure interpretations (C&DIs) for?
knowledgechecksdata.question: Which of the following disclosure requirements did the SEC recently issue compliance and disclosure interpretations (C&DIs) for?
knowledgechecksdata.instruction: Select all applicable answers and click Submit.

individual.feedback: A is correct. The SEC staff issued a series of Compliance & Disclosure Interpretations (C&DIs) covering certain implementation and practical questions related to pay versus performance disclosure requirements in 2023.

B is incorrect. The SEC staff did not issue Compliance & Disclosure Interpretations (C&DIs) related to Artificial intelligence. The SEC has made public remarks and emphasized the importance of ensuring representations of a Company regarding Artificial Intelligence are not false or misleading. The correct answer is A. The SEC staff issued a series of Compliance & Disclosure Interpretations (C&DI’s) covering certain implementation and practical questions related to pay versus performance disclosure requirements in 2023.

C is incorrect. The SEC did not issue Compliance & Disclosure Interpretations (C&DIs) related to Segment reporting. Segment reporting was one of the top SEC staff comment letter topics in the most recent comment cycle (12 months ended June 30, 2024). The correct answer is A. The SEC staff issued a series of Compliance & Disclosure Interpretations (C&DI’s) covering certain implementation and practical questions related to pay versus performance disclosure requirements in 2023.

D is incorrect. The SEC did not issue Compliance & Disclosure Interpretations (C&DIs) related to Critical accounting estimates. The Director of the Division of Corporation Finance noted critical accounting estimates to be a focus area of the 2024 disclosure review program. The correct answer is A. The SEC staff issued a series of Compliance & Disclosure Interpretations (C&DIs) covering certain implementation and practical questions related to pay versus performance disclosure requirements in 2023.

knowledgechecksdata.title: Which one of the following is a top comment topic area identified in the most recent comment cycle (12 months ended June 30, 2024)?
knowledgechecksdata.question: Which one of the following is a top comment topic area identified in the most recent comment cycle (12 months ended June 30, 2024)?
knowledgechecksdata.instruction: Select all applicable answers and click Submit.

individual.feedback: A is incorrect. While the SEC Staff did issue comments specifically related to cybersecurity, these comments were not as prevalent as comments issued related to revenue recognition. The majority of comments related to cybersecurity focused on Item 1.05 Material Cybersecurity Incidents. The correct answer is B. Revenue recognition was one of the top accounting topic areas to receive comments from the SEC for each of the previous 3 years. The revenue recognition topic area is a recurring area and received a high percentage of the accounting related comment letters with the comments being heavily weighted towards revenue disclosures.

B is correct. Revenue recognition was one of the top accounting topic areas to receive comments from the SEC for each of the previous 3 years. The revenue recognition topic area is a recurring area and received a high percentage of the accounting related comment letters with the comments being heavily weighted towards revenue disclosures.

C is incorrect. While the SEC Staff did issue comments specifically related to artificial intelligence, these comments were not as prevalent as comments issued related to revenue recognition. The majority of comments related to artificial intelligence focused on credibility and adequacy of disclosure. The correct answer is B. Revenue recognition was one of the top accounting topic areas to receive comments from the SEC for each of the previous 3 years. The revenue recognition topic area is a recurring area and received a high percentage of the accounting related comment letters with the comments being heavily weighted towards revenue disclosures.

D is incorrect. While the SEC Staff did issue comments specifically related to debt and equity, these comments were not as prevalent as comments issued related to revenue recognition. The majority of comments related to debt and equity focused on classification and inadequate disclosure. The correct answer is B. Revenue recognition was one of the top accounting topic areas to receive comments from the SEC for each of the previous 3 years. The revenue recognition topic area is a recurring area and received a high percentage of the accounting related comment letters with the comments being heavily weighted towards revenue disclosures.

knowledgechecksdata.title:
In the most recent comment letter cycle, which two topics were in the top topic areas receiving comments?
I. Third-party experts
II. Balance Sheet Matters
III. MD&A
IV. Non-GAAP financial measures
knowledgechecksdata.question:
In the most recent comment letter cycle, which two topics were in the top topic areas receiving comments?
I. Third-party experts
II. Balance Sheet Matters
III. MD&A
IV. Non-GAAP financial measures
knowledgechecksdata.instruction: Select all applicable answers and click Submit.

individual.feedback: A is incorrect. While the SEC did issue comments related to third-party experts and balance sheet matters and the SEC continues to focus on improving disclosures in these areas, they were not the most prolific of the SEC’s comments. The correct answer is D. Consistent with recent years, two of the top topic areas to receive comments remained MD&A and non-GAAP financial measures.

B is incorrect. While the SEC did issue comments related to third-party experts and the SEC continues to focus on improving transparency of disclosures in this area, they were not one of the most prolific of the SEC’s comments. The correct answer is D. Consistent with recent years, two of the top topic areas to receive comments remained MD&A and non-GAAP financial measures.

C is incorrect. While the SEC did issue comments related to balance sheet matters and the SEC continues to focus on improving disclosures in this area, it was not one of the most prolific of the SEC’s comments. The correct answer is D. Consistent with recent years, two of the top topic areas to receive comments remained MD&A and non-GAAP financial measures.
D is correct. Consistent with recent years, two of the top topic areas receiving comments in the most recent comment letter cycle remained MD&A and non-GAAP financial measures.

knowledgechecksdata.title: What aspect of non-GAAP financial measures was NOT noted as a significant source of comments in the most recent cycle?
knowledgechecksdata.question: What aspect of non-GAAP financial measures was NOT noted as a significant source of comments in the most recent cycle?
knowledgechecksdata.instruction: Select all applicable answers and click Submit.

individual.feedback: A is incorrect. Tailored accounting policies was noted as a significant source of comments in the most recent cycle of non-GAAP financial measure comments. Using a tailored accounting principle in place of a GAAP principle can be misleading. The correct answer is D. Aspects of non-GAAP financial measures that received the most comment in the most recent cycle were tailored accounting principles, prominence, exclusion of normal and recurring cash operating expenses, and appropriate labeling and disclosure of non-GAAP financial measures. Comments related to non-GAAP rules around liquidity measures, while issued, were not as prevalent.

B is incorrect. Prominence was noted as a significant source of comments in the most recent cycle of non-GAAP financial measure comments. A non-GAAP measure cannot be presented more prominently than its most directly comparable GAAP measure. The correct answer is D. Aspects of non-GAAP financial measures that received the most comment in the most recent cycle were tailored accounting principles, prominence, exclusion of normal and recurring cash operating expenses, and appropriate labeling and disclosure of non-GAAP financial measures. Comments related to non-GAAP rules around liquidity measures, while issued, were not as prevalent.

C is incorrect. Appropriate labeling & disclosure was noted as a significant source of comments in the most recent cycle of non-GAAP financial measure comments. Not providing clear and appropriate labels and descriptions of a non-GAAP financial measure to indicate it is a non-GAAP financial measure can be misleading. The correct answer is D. Aspects of non-GAAP financial measures that received the most comment in the most recent cycle were tailored accounting principles, prominence, exclusion of normal and recurring cash operating expenses, and appropriate labeling and disclosure of non-GAAP financial measures. Comments related to non-GAAP rules around liquidity measures, while issued, were not as prevalent.

D is correct. Aspects of non-GAAP financial measures that received the most comment in the most recent cycle were tailored accounting principles, prominence, exclusion of normal and recurring cash operating expenses, and appropriate labeling and disclosure of non-GAAP financial measures. Comments related to non-GAAP rules around liquidity measures, while issued, were not as prevalent.

startPage.title: Assessment
startPage.content:
Congratulations on completing the course!


Click Start to take the assessment and see how much you have learned.


In order to receive CPE credit, you must score a 70% of higher on this assessment. The assessment includes a series of multiple-choice questions. You will be provided consolidated feedback at the end of the assessment. Feel free to review the course content before you begin the assessment.


Good luck!!
startPage.successText: Congratulations! You have completed this assessment with a score of

PassText.congratsText:
Congratulations! You have successfully completed this assessment and will receive CPE credit.

Your assessment results are shown below.
PassText.InstructionText: Click on the EXIT button to exit this course and return to the main menu.

FailText.FailSubTitle:
Your score is not sufficient to earn you CPE credit points.

Your assessment results are shown below.

Retake.RetakeInstructionText: Click Retake Assessment to reattempt the assessment, or click Exit to exit this course and return to the main menu.

FailText.infoText: You may close this window to revisit the course.

resultPage.AssessmentCloseText:
Your assessment progress will be lost and you will have to restart from the beginning.

Do you really want to close the assessment?

body.question: Which of the following is NOT an example of a Form 8-K disclosure trend related to cybersecurity incidents?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: The filing of Item 1.05 on Form 8-K ranged from five days to 25 days from the date the incident was detected.
Approximately 85% of registrants disclosed that they believed that the incident had no material impact (or reasonably likely impact) on the company.
Half of the registrants that filed Item 1.05 on Form 8-K made an initial disclosure on Item 8.01 at which point the registrant had not yet determined whether the incident was material.
The average filing time from the date the cybersecurity incident was detected was approximately 13 days.

body.question: Which of the following is an example of a SEC comment letter that may be received related to the prominence principle?
body.instruction: Check the correct option and select Submit.

choice.cdata-section: Adjustments to a non-GAAP financial measure for acquisition and divestiture costs that include compensation expenses associated with employee retention associated with onboarding employees from acquired entities.
Presentation of organic sales, net of an adjustment for “sales of disposed businesses that did not qualify for discontinued operations.”
Presentation of 'Percentage change in Adjusted EBITDA,' without also presenting the comparable GAAP measure with equal or greater importance.
Labeling of Cash Flow from Operations as a non-GAAP financial measure which is a label commonly used interchangeably with Cash Flow from Operating Activities.
